content.description: Interesting mixtures of features! Be sure to use handicap door opener and wood frame of the entrance as the start. The finish is topping out the head of the troubadour. The crux for me was going to the lower hand of the man. Downclimb is kind of sketchy so be careful!
content.location: Yardley garden, near Sledd hall. Very close to Dauer.

content.description: Classic arch builder problem. Be sure not to fall at the top so you don't hit the rail in between your legs on the way down!

Start on the pattern on the right side of the door and on the left side of the cisco box in the square cutout on the wall. Very fun crux going to the sloper in line with the Century Tower sign featured in the photo.
content.location: It's the building mascot of UF- Century Tower! It's on Newell Drive.

content.description: The Buckman E sign is fair game to use. The first move is definitely the crux, good luck! Match on Buck Man's head to finish the boulder. Start the route by squatting in the grass matching the slopery ledge.
content.location: Buckman hall E, across from chemistry buildings.

content.description: Buildering routes on campus. These boulders are characterized by picturesque stone slopers and crimps, but lack of good footholds. Pad plus spotter recommended- falling on concrete hurts!
